intro: Chamaesyce alsiniflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and open fields, and is considered a member of the Asteraceae family.
